name: Professor Professorson 1.0
description: This is my first shot at a Professor deck. Basically using all the best programs from the spin cycle and cheating them out with test run/scavenge. I'm new at this so I'd love any comments and criticisms so that I can hopefully take this to regionals. Thanks!

name: Tyreinasaurus Rex
description:
Different idea based off of Master Dino Racer. Trimmed some cards in order to get a more consistently ideal opening draw. Added Djinn and Keyhole. Changed to Reina for more credit tax.

The idea here is to have 2 breakers that are 5+ and run a LOT. Either Mimic or Yog on Dino, saving sucker tokens for the breaker that doesn't get hosted.

Try to keep them poor with acct siph and vamp.

This probably needs some sort of multi access, but im not sure where to place it. Medium or Nerve Agent perhaps... memory issues again...

name: Jinteki - A thesis in experimentation
description:
Mixed ice bag, designed to stop runs and punish through pain.

A few ambushes and good economy.

name: NBN v1
description: This deck is design for quick scoring agendas and keeping runner in distance. Hurting and tagging ice's, closed accounts for cutting off money, and psychographics for advancing.

name: The Spanish Inquisition
description: My own Weyland build. I've liked the "Because We Built It" identity since I got into the game, so I decided to throw together a deck around it. I don't expect it to be very competitive, but it was a whole lot of fun to play the first time I played it. It is far enough outside of my local meta that "Nobody Expects" it.

name: Rielle deep R&D
description:
basic Idea is: dinosaurus with yog + rielle ability (+ tinkering + paintbrush just to be sure) fast and economic runs. run where? deeply r&d ofc. R&D interface, maker's eye. Prof contacts and magnum opus and diesel as economy/draw engine. Test run as "demonic tutor" for icebreakers (yes, old MTG player here :) ) datasucker + personal touch for mimic (or yog if you install mimic on dinosaurus). Plascrete because Punitive Counter makes it fundamental. Economy: daily casts, armitage and Kati jones

clone chip because....well: better safe than sorry. :D

name: Medical Emergency
description: Playing around with the idea of a Jinteki FA deck with mostly binary ice.

name: Jinteki Matchpoint Run v2.1
description:
Tried JMPRv2 and it was slow. Couldn't find any of the six agendas in time before the runner could set up. Adding Fast Track and Anonymous Tip to see how it would speed up the deck.

Wondering if Shi Kyu might help - net damage or -1 agenda point, That would mean the runner would need to score 3 agendas to win.

Any Suggestions? Any thoughts would help. Thanks.

name: Simple Jin HnP
description:
Playing Jinteki with less mind games as compared to normal. Tested this a couple of times and seems it works quite well. Focus is on getting agendas rather than trapping the runner. There is enough net damage done by ICE and the ambush assets. Keep Shock!, Snare and Fetal AI in hand when possible,

Note: PAD Campaign will be changed to Mental Health Clinic.

Any suggestions would be much welcomed. Thanks.

name: Tax Loopholes
description:
“We have found the latest way to increase profits.” she heard him say. “By processing the majority new business ventures through the SanSan region, we are able to increase our profits by nearly 200%.” Director Haas knew she needed to make a decision, and quickly. She had just finished a meeting with the new security teams, feeling reassured in the new upgrades to their defenses. The security team had ensured us that the latest upgrades would be secure for quite sometime in face of attack. They also mentioned that while the system was not flawless, it would be able to deter attacks even when compromised.

This is the latest update to my favorite fast advance deck. I aim to fast advance through multiple means. It includes a ton of recursion effects to ensure you always are able to get that train rolling again. I have designed the deck to be taxing on the runner even when they have a full rig. The ability to recur Biotic Labors, SanSans, or money/JH is insanely powerful. Let them spend 10+ credits to trash that SanSan, make them do it again. NAPD has made it even better. I have had all 3 copies in archives, runner seeing them and unable to steal them. Then I manage to get a jackson out before he could get money.

I am currently 5-2 with this exact deck, but have placed in the top 4 in 2 store championships, 2nd with one version, and 4th with this exact deck. I've also won tournaments with an earlier version, before a couple of Datapacks were released. I have debated Reclamation Order, but I have sided with archived memories for my type of play.

Let me know your thoughts!

Tournament winning deck - http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2425/2013-denver-central-s3-1st-place-corp-deck

2nd place Store Championship deck - http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/4619/hb-fast-advance

name: HB Fast Advance
description: I placed 2nd in the Denver Central Games' Store championship with this version of my fast advance love affair and HB.
